Issues.Title: CodeDomSerializationStore in not marked as Serializable
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview9-014004
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

We faced a problem when porting our application to .NET Core 3.  We have a copy/paste functionality which is implemented similar to the standard copy/paste (via [IDesignerSerializationService](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/abd5a3d167ef57ee478912e97f194ff3a21d14b2/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/CommandSet.cs#L1269)). 
On copying we get the SerializationException:
'Type System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.CodeDomComponentSerializationService + CodeDomSerializationStore' in Assembly 'System.Windows.Forms.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089' is not marked as serializable.'

–°an we expect the attribute to appear in the next release?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CodeDomSerializationStore in not marked as Serializable" (#1831)

Issues.Title: Type 'System.Drawing.Printing.Margins' is not marked as serializable
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Type 'System.Drawing.Printing.Margins' is not marked as serializable" (#1835)

Issues.Title: Consider updating AccessibleObject to allow enabling UIA and IAccessibleEx from custom controls
Issues.Body:
At this moment there is no way to add/implement modern accessibility patterns for custom controls that inherit from Control other than implementing these from scratch.

Adding IAccessibleEx implementation requires to disable already existing internal IAccessibleEx implementation.

Implementing UIA also requires to override WndProc method which may be not trivial for C# developers.

So there are few ways to work around this: to open corresponding APIs to enable/disable UIA/IAccessibleEx-provided accessibility or enable modern accessibility implementation for all controls by default.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Consider updating AccessibleObject to allow enabling UIA and IAccessibleEx from custom controls" (#1834)

Issues.Title: DataGridView InvalidOperationException: This operation cannot be performed while an auto-filled column is being resized.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0 Preview9
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

**Problem description:**
[stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34344499/invalidoperationexception-this-operation-cannot-be-performed-while-an-auto-fill)
DataGridView with AutoSizeMode == Fill and ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode == AutoSize. The problem is that if the mouse cursor accidentally hovers the upper left cell of the grid when the form loads, the application throws an InvalidOperationException.

The code is trying to access dataGridView.TopLeftHeaderCell, which when happens for the first time actually creates that cell and triggers some layout actions not expected at that moment.
Fix: We need to make sure that the TopLeftHeaderCell is created before DataGridView handle.


**Actual behavior:**
InvalidOperationException: This operation cannot be performed while an auto-filled column is being resized.

**Expected behavior:**
No Exception.

**Minimal repro:**
[DataGridViewTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3590612/DataGridViewTest.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGridView InvalidOperationException: This operation cannot be performed while an auto-filled column is being resized." (#1830)

Issues.Title: UI Layout broken in later previews.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0 preview 9
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
We are porting a .Net framework winforms app to core. Up until preview 6, all of the ui was working exactly the same to .net framework, but since preview 6 we've started encountering various things that no longer behave as before. The first example is on the start form for the application, where the menu panel is no longer centered correctly.

**Expected behavior:** .NET Framework and Core 3.0 previews 1-5 look like this
![preview5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4446559/64530874-0b0a4e00-d306-11e9-84e3-d896d2f358b3.png)

**Actual behavior:** Preview 6-9 do this
![preview9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4446559/64530880-0e9dd500-d306-11e9-92f7-98d680690200.png)

**Minimal repro:**
[uibug.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3590449/uibug.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "UI Layout broken in later previews." (#1827)

Issues.Title: Two nodes  ‚ÄòWPF‚Äô and ‚Äò.NET Core‚Äô are missing on C# winforms core application
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET Core 3.0.100-rc1-014181
* VS: 16.4.0 Preview1.0 [29304.142.master]
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
**More info:**
This is a regression issue from d16.3 P3.

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create a C# winforms core application.
2. Right-click the project in solution Explorer window, then click 'Add' to open the "Add New item" page.

**Actual behavior:** 
Two nodes  ‚ÄòWPF‚Äô and ‚Äò.NET Core‚Äô are missing on Add New item window.

![Actual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/64510977-dbfbd880-d315-11e9-9da7-47efd0ece59c.PNG)

**Expected behavior:**
These two nodes are showing correctly on Add New item window.

![Expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/64510930-c4bceb00-d315-11e9-843e-8e4ef30dc1bc.PNG)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Two nodes  ‚ÄòWPF‚Äô and ‚Äò.NET Core‚Äô are missing on C# winforms core application" (#1822)

Issues.Title: Remove VB WinForms templates from CLI
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version: .NET Core 3.0.100-rc1-014181
VS: 16.4.0 Preview1.0 [29304.142.master]
Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
There is a previous GitHub issue [1698](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/1698) about remove VB WinForms templates from .NET Core 3.0, after this change, now we cannot create VB winforms core application from VS, but still can create VB winforms core application from CLI.

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open a command-line interface.
2. Input the following command: 
   dotnet new -l
   dotnet new winforms -lang VB -o "C:\Users\v-jiaol\Desktop\demo\test1"

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 There exist VB language of winforms template at the CLI and can create VB winforms core application.
![Actual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/64513521-4b27fb80-d31b-11e9-8f3a-b5691877f13f.png)
![Actual1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/64513526-4e22ec00-d31b-11e9-82cd-9d715ae6f75b.png)

**Expected behavior:**
The VB winforms core application should not be created at the CLI.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove VB WinForms templates from CLI" (#1823)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup" (#1818)

Issues.Title: We need tests for calling COM interface methods from c++
Issues.Body:
We need tests for various interfaces implemented by managed classes (e.g. IOleControlSite etc)

The best way to test this would be to implement tests in c++ and PInvoke them passing the managed class as an interface as an a IntPtr to unmanaged code. We‚Äôd then call functions from c++ and test things like HRESULTS etc

I have a prototype but not sure how to integrate a test c++ dll  into the product infrastructure
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "We need tests for calling COM interface methods from c++" (#1817)
